column4: when I try to install anything using Synaptic, I get the following error, then nothing, and no packages will install.: dpkg: parse error, in file `/var/lib/dpkg/available' near line 1:        field name `        E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (2)  A package failed to install. Trying to recover:

when I try to install anything using Synaptic, I get the following error, then nothing, and no packages will install.: dpkg: parse error, in file `/var/lib/dpkg/available' near line 1:        field name `        E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (2)  A package failed to install. Trying to recover:
I did gksudo gedit /var/bin/dpkg/available  and got a blank page.
do a sudo aptitude update and then check the available file again
reloaded repos in Synaptic, tried installing another package. Same error.
i am out of ideas then .. sorry
u did delete the file tho, right?
actually....the file doesn't exist to delete...but I think automatix may be the culprit....I'll know in a few minutes....
I know it should...Automatix is successfully installing some fonts now...We'll see if it will put things right.
will you pastebin your /var/lib/dpkg/available file please?
